data.extended_info: ServerID=C27HBSSPAXR01; Analyzer=HOSTIPS_8000; AnalyzerName=McAfee Host Intrusion Prevention; AnalyzerVersion=8.0.0.2151; ThreatType=setattr; ThreatActionTaken=hip.reaction.permit; SourceProcessName=/opt/sybase/OCS-15_0/bin/isql; files=/tmp/ctisql_W0voaJ; new_permission=384; process_chain=/sbin/init /usr/sbin/crond /usr/sbin/crond /bin/su /bin/tcsh /bin/bash /opt/sybase/OCS-15_0/bin/isql;
data.message: ePO HIPS Threat: (Refer to KB article 51504 for details about supported platforms.) This event indicates an attempt to create a file with the SUID/SGID bit set which can indicate a suspicious operation.  Attackers sometimes leave copies of command shells (with the SUID/SGID bit set) on the system, so they can use the bit set as a \"backdoor\" to elevate their privileges at a later time.
